title: AU Deals: A Slew of Sandbox Freebies and Discounts on Monster Hunter Wilds, FC25, Outlaws, and More!

text: Cheap scores for an epic weekend of play.Thank your own personal deity‚Äîpossibly Gurlugon‚Äîit's Friday! There‚Äôs something here for everyone, so get scrolling to get saving..This Day in Gaming üéÇIn retro news I‚Äôm celebrating the 22nd birthday of Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance. I have fond memories of scoring this at launch and being blown away by the delightfully weird-arse content within. I‚Äôm talking 500 ‚ÄúVR‚Äù challenges and alternative missions that let us control Snake and Raiden in sorties ranging from classic sneaking to absurdities like battling giant soldiers. What were the absolute cherries on top here? "Snake Tales" mode, which consisted of five non-canonical side missions starring our beloved (and underutilized) Solid Snake. Plus a Skateboarding Mode (PS2 exclusive), inspired by Konami‚Äôs Evolution Skateboarding. html:
Cheap scores for an epic weekend of play.

Thank your own personal deity‚Äîpossibly Gurlugon‚Äîit's Friday! It's time to clear space on your SSDs and make room in your backlog because this week‚Äôs lineup of deals is packed with unmissable discounts on some of the best titles across all platforms. There‚Äôs something here for everyone, so get scrolling to get saving..

This Day in Gaming üéÇ

In retro news I‚Äôm celebrating the 22nd birthday of Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance. I have fond memories of scoring this at launch and being blown away by the delightfully weird-arse content within. I‚Äôm talking 500 ‚ÄúVR‚Äù challenges and alternative missions that let us control Snake and Raiden in sorties ranging from classic sneaking to absurdities like battling giant soldiers.

What were the absolute cherries on top here? "Snake Tales" mode, which consisted of five non-canonical side missions starring our beloved (and underutilized) Solid Snake. Plus a Skateboarding Mode (PS2 exclusive), inspired by Konami‚Äôs Evolution Skateboarding. Nailing tricks and smashing objectives on a Big Shell halfpipe was as radical as it sounds.

Aussie bdays for notable games

- Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance (XB) 2003. eBay

- Master of Orion III (PC) 2003. Get

- Tenchu: Wrath of Heaven (PS2) 2003. eBay

- Pro Evo 2008 (PC,PS2/3,Wii,X360) 2008. eBay

Nice Savings for Nintendo Switch

On Switch, Super Mario RPG is slashed by 25%, bringing back the legendary Square-Enix and Nintendo collaboration that gave us Geno‚Äîone of the most fan-requested Smash Bros. characters ever. Meanwhile, Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled speeds in at 31% off, a remaster that stays true to the original while adding the online play that 1999-me could never even have conceived of, let alone hoped for.

Super Mario RPG

Super Mario RPG is considered a classic for a reason, and this wonderfully faithful remake makes it easy for anyone who missed it in the SNES era to see why. 8/10, great.

Purchase Cheap for PC

PC gamers can grab Mafia II: Definitive Edition and Saints Row: The Third for free‚Äîtwo crime-filled open-world epics that defined their eras. The latter is particularly amusing, being a GTA clone that evolved into an over-the-top parody, complete with an alien invasion storyline.

Exciting Bargains for Xbox

Over on Xbox Series X, The Witcher 3: Complete Edition is 45% off, meaning you can experience one of the greatest RPGs of all time for less. And then there's a cheaper RoboCop: Rogue City, which has some pretty sweet DLC on the way.

Monster Hunter Wilds

Wilds continues to smooth off the traditionally rough edges of the series in smart ways, reducing as much friction as possible that could get in the way of you grabbing any of its exceptionally fun weapons and planting them firmly in a monster. 8/10.

Pure Scores for PlayStation

Lastly, PS5 players can prepare to die repeatedly in Elden Ring at 31% off‚Äîa GOAT experience that only got better with its Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. And if you‚Äôre craving a samurai epic, Rise of the Ronin offers historical accuracy blended with Team Ninja‚Äôs signature action.

Persona 5 is a massive, gorgeous JRPG with well over 100 hours of gameplay for completionists. With more to do than ever and the series' strongest story to date.
